intro: Pilosella onegensis subsp. glaucochroa, commonly known as the glaucous pilosella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are usually hairy and often have a bluish-gray hue, which is reflected in its common name. The species is known for its small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, contributing to the floral diversity of its native environment.
